title: Project title
text:
Math Expressions
You can write LaTeX math expressions inside a pair of dollar signs, e.g. $\alpha+\beta$ renders \(\alpha + \beta\). You can use the display style with double dollar signs:
$$\bar{X}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^nX_i$$
\[
\bar{X}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^nX_i
\]
Limitations:

The source code of a LaTeX math expression must be in one line, unless it is inside a pair of double dollar signs, in which case the starting $$ must appear in the very beginning of a line, followed immediately by a non-space character, and the ending $$ must be at the end of a line, led by a non-space character;
There should not be spaces after the opening $ or before the closing $.

title: Project title
text:
Feeling adventurous?

You are welcomed to use the default styling of the slides. In fact, that's what I expect majority of you will do. You will differentiate yourself with the content of your presentation.
But some of you might want to play around with slide styling. Some solutions for this can be found at https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/revealjs.

title: Team Contract
text:
Vik Ruhil, vikruhil@arizona.edu
Yash Sharma, yashsharma28@arizona.edu
Raghav Upadhyay, raghavupadhyay@arizona.edu

Smit Shah, smitshah@arizona.edu
Tushar Shrivastava,tshrivastava@arizona.edu





A comprehencive view of the IOT network infrastructure during various types of network attacks e.g. DDOS, man in middle, Arp flood etc. Objective of the project is to monitor the behaviour of network parameters during a network attack vs normal traffic flow. The project will outline which parameters are effected during an active network attack e.g. during an arp flood the broadcast traffic which is icmp type of protocol will see high jump in fwd_pkts_tot/bwd_pkts_tot etc.

title: Team Contract
text:
Project Goals:
Few of the goals that will be achieved during this project are as follows

Understand the Software development Life Cycle (SDLC). As our team is using Jira to track our work progress and follow Agile methodology.
How to follow project management as we have a dedicated scrum master in our team.
Understand the workflow of creating a R project.
Details and in depth use of R packages. This includes various visualization methods to keep plots within data-to-ink ratio.
Our team goal is go through consensus process and replicating real world team decision making process.
Team will go through story creation based on data and understand how to come up with meaningful questions.
Our team goal is to reproduce an industry standard report that can be presented to stakeholders.
Team will be able to present the project confidently and answers questions initialy decided between team members.
Team goal is to understand IOT networks and network as standalone technology for this project.
Team will understand the network attacks and how that impacts the IOT infrastructure.

title: Team Contract
text:
Learning Objectives:

Agile Methodology
Project Management
R language and packages
Team work
Time management
Visualization and analysis using R
Research meaningful questions
Exploratory Data Analysis
Data Manipulation
Feature Engineering

title: Team Contract
text: Team Roles and Responsibilities

title: Team Contract
text:
Roles:
Project Manager: Vik Ruhil – Ensures timelines are met, organizes meetings, and manages communications.
Data Analysts: Raghav Upadhyay, Partha Vemuri – Responsible for data cleaning, analysis, and exploratory visualizations.
Visualization Specialist: Yash Sharma, Chaitanya Suralkar – Designs the final visualizations and makes aesthetic choices.
Documentation Lead: Smit Shah, Tushar Shrivastava – Keeps detailed notes, ensures all project decisions are documented, and handles the final report. Responsibilities:

title: Team Contract
text:
General Responsibilities:
Each team member is responsible for: Participating actively in all meetings. Completing their assigned tasks on time. Communicating openly and promptly if issues arise.

title: Team Contract
text:
Communication Plan
Meeting Schedule: Daily, 5:30 pm MST via Microsoft Teams.
Primary Communication Platform: Microfsoft Teams.
Decision-Making Process: Decisions will be made by consensus; if a consensus cannot be reached, a vote will be taken. (If vote is hung we do veto)

title: Team Contract
text:
Work Plan and Timeline
Milestones: Data Collection and Cleaning: Completed by [Date].
Exploratory Data Analysis: Completed by [Date].
Design of Visualizations: Completed by [Date].
Final Presentation and Report: Completed by [Date].
Task Assignments: [Use a table to assign tasks to team members with due dates.]

title: Team Contract
text:
Accountability and Expectations
Attendance Policy: All team members are expected to attend scheduled meetings unless previously discussed.
Quality of Work: All deliverables should be completed to a professional standard.
Deadlines: All members are responsible for meeting deadlines. If someone cannot meet a deadline, they must notify the team in advance.

title: Team Contract
text:
Conflict Resolution Plan
Conflict Management: Discuss the issue openly during a team meeting. Attempt to resolve the issue through compromise. If the conflict persists, consult the project supervisor for guidance.

Signatures
By signing below, each team member agrees to the terms of this contract and commits to working together effectively and respectfully.
